Crimes.Crime_Name: Possessing cocaine for the purpose of trafficking
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Procedural fairness in ID hearing process
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Referral to Admissibility Hearing and Judicial Review
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Applicant had knowledge of all information transmitted; no request for additional documents
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate breach of procedural fairness
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Not explicitly raised; information already known to applicant
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Procedural fairness requires disclosure of report and opportunity to make submissions under IRPA s.44
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to request Highlights Report or interview notes
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decisions
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Process was fair; no obligation to disclose internal documents absent request
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Lack of disclosure of supplementary materials before referral
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities in administrative context
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Did not request additional documents or reasons
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of CBSA and ID decisions
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Set aside referral and admissibility decisions
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Serious criminality due to drug trafficking conviction
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Federal Court – Immigration Division and Federal Court
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Procedural fairness under administrative law principles

Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Disclosure of officer-prepared documents and right to make submissions
Crimes.Evidence_Disclosure_Status: Highlights Report and interview notes not disclosed, but not requested

Crimes.Evidentiary_Issue: Whether supplementary documents must be disclosed absent request

Crimes.Risk_Nexus: Link between drug trafficking and threat to public safety
Crimes.Basis_for_Decision: Conviction for drug trafficking constituting serious criminality
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not applicable – facts based on conviction

Crimes.Basis_for_Inadmissibility: Conviction for trafficking in a controlled substance
Crimes.Risk_Assessment_Factors: Nature of offense, potential harm to community
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timing and scope of document disclosure
Crimes.Relevant_Factors_Considered: Criminal history, nature of offense, procedural rights

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Procedural fairness in preparation and referral of admissibility report
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: All information in report already known to applicant
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: No challenge to truth of underlying facts
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Procedural fairness does not require automatic disclosure of internal working documents
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to request interview notes or explanations
